review_blob: Pours a light amber color with a nice head. It has a strong citrusy hop aroma with a small malt smell. Taste is of malt with a strong hop bitterness, but not too strong. This beer is lowly carbonated with a medium mouthfeel. Its a good hoppy amber ale.

Pours a golden color with a small lasting head. and good lacing. Aroma is strong with citrus like hops and has a small malt aroma. Taste of light malt and heavy hop flavor with a slight alcoholic aftertaste. A pretty good IPA.

Pours a copper color. There is a small head that quickly diminishes while leaving a little lacing on the glass. Aroma is strong from citrus like hops. Has a low level of carbonation with a medium mouth feel.  Taste is similar to aroma with fruit like hops, but a malt flavor is there to balance it. A good example of an English IPA.

Color was a very dark brown, with some red. It had a good off-white head with some lacing. There was a moderate malt smell with a strong hop aroma. Initial flavor is sweet, with a bitter coffee finish. Overall, this is a very good porter.
Aroma is nothing special, it smells like any other beer. This is a cloudy beer with a white head. The flavor is a little weak, but would be a refreshing beer for a summer day.
